alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 5:17AM PST until December 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...PERIODS OF HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY, WITH LOWERING SNOW LEVELS... In between storm systems, lighter showery precipitation will linger today with snow levels tending to rise into the 3000 to 4000 ft range later this morning through tonight. Snow levels should be above 3500 feet across most of our area Monday morning. Steadier precipitation will move in tonight ahead of another cold front, resulting in heavy mountain snow along the highest portions of highway 36 and highway 3. As the cold front moves through from midday through Monday afternoon, snow levels will lower while some heavy precipitation lingers. Snow levels will drop below 2500 feet in the afternoon across Humboldt County, even reaching 2000 feet Monday evening across most of northwest California. That will allow for heavy snow around Berry Summit. Fortunately precipitation become lighter and more showery Monday evening, with lighter accumulations on the passes farther east along the Highway 299 corridor. Some minor accumulations of a coating to locally as much as 2 inches will be possible at low elevations through Tuesday morning as snow levels lower near or even below 1000 feet. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches at Berry Summit on Highway 299, with higher amounts possible on other rural travel corridors above 3000 feet. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Interior and Southern Humboldt Interior Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM to 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult along Highway 299 near Berry Summit, with slippery, snow-covered road conditions and poor visibility. Some high elevation rural roadways may become impassable.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

area.areaDesc: Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior
